intro: Phyllanthus ugandensis, commonly known as African date palm, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in dense inflorescences, which are followed by fleshy, red berries. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and savanna habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
